|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = <!-- Size of RAM --> |ram1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = <!-- Leave blank --> |defaultpass = password |defaultssid = Wavit11 |defaultssid_regex = ^Wavit11$ |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->

}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== [https://deviwiki.com/files/vendors/Mitsumi/Wavit11.7z Copy of the included CD]
The device does not have a HTTP interface for configuration.
The default configuration has the device set to Ad-hoc mode with the SSID 'Wavit11'. The default Ad-hoc mode is not 802.11 compatible and thus the devices are invisible by default to 802.11 monitoring software. The devices may assume a Xircom MAC (OUI 00:10:A4) when in 802.11-compatible Ad-Hoc mode.
ID/OD/Len measurements are not exact.
The devices support the following modes.. *AdHoc *Infrastructure *Both (Ad-hoc + Infrastructure) *Access Point *Wireless Bridge *802.11 AdHoc
[[Category:English Documentation]]
